column4: shit. how do I uninstall nvidia-glx packages if all I have is a command line?
why not just wait?  and no.
as long as you haven't installed anything without going through apt/(whatever frontend), you're good
of course, it is still beta software.  So, you may wish to hold off until it's finalized.
I did install the proprietary nvidia driver
no, I downloaded it fron nvidia's site
oh, why not just use the one in the repositories?
fair enough.  How did you install it?
had to also install make, gcc 3.4, the kernel source tree, and then the install compiled a kernel module from that.
I get GDM, and login works, then it tries to open gnome and I get just a mouse pointer and the background color. I can move the mouse, but nothing else loads.
ok, I tried logging in in safe mode, still no go. Doesn't work for root either.
